page.title: 02The Devil's Hole (1)
page.content:
The Devil's Hole is out at St.Mary. The hole is under a cliff. Boulders are hurled about in the sea, not pebbles. The legend of Devil's hole started on October 20th 1851 when "La Josephine" went past the west of Jersey but they misjudged the tides and were swept into the north of the island. "La Josephine" drove ashore under the cliffs called{'Creux de Vis'.}The crew remained onboard but at night the weather became calm. One man jumped overboard to get help but was swept away and was never seen again. The rest of the men got onto a rock and were saved. As the wreck broke up it was discovered that the figurehead had been washed up through the hole.
(continued)
